hero.caption: Full-cycle web studio
hero.subtitle: We build websites for
hero.fullBleedAlt: Website creation process at NAKO Agency

items.title: STRATEGY
items.subtitle: Strategy and structure
items.description: We start with deep analysis of your business, target audience, and competitors. We develop a site structure that guides visitors to the target action.

items.title: DESIGN
items.subtitle: Premium-minimal design
items.description: We create a unique visual style without templates. Lots of whitespace, clear typography, thoughtful animation — a website that stands out and is remembered.

items.title: SPEED
items.subtitle: Speed and SEO
items.description: We optimize every page for Core Web Vitals. Fast loading, proper semantics, technical SEO — your site will be loved by both Google and users.

items.title: INTEGRATIONS
items.subtitle: Integrations (payments/CRM/Telegram)
items.description: We connect payment systems, CRM, analytics, Telegram notifications, and any other services needed to automate your business.

items.title: SUPPORT
items.subtitle: Post-launch support
items.description: We don't abandon you after project delivery. Technical support, minor tweaks, consultations — we're here when you need us.

items.title: Expert website
items.description: Personal website for specialists, coaches, consultants. Sells your expertise and attracts clients.

items.title: Online store
items.description: Full e-commerce with catalog, cart, and payments. Sales automation and integrations.

items.title: Landing page
items.description: One-page website with high conversion for launching a product, service, or ad campaign.

steps.title: Brief
steps.description: We discuss goals, audience, and project tasks. Fill out the brief and define key success metrics.

steps.title: Prototype
steps.description: We create site structure, wireframes, and user scenarios. We agree on the logic before design.

steps.title: Design
steps.description: We develop a unique visual style. Each screen is a separate composition with attention to detail.

steps.title: Development
steps.description: We code in Next.js focusing on performance. Clean code, SEO optimization, fast loading.

steps.title: Content
steps.description: We fill the site with text and media. We help with copywriting and visual content selection.

steps.title: Testing
steps.description: We test on all devices and browsers. We test forms, integrations, and user scenarios.

steps.title: Launch
steps.description: We deploy to production, set up domain, SSL, analytics. We hand over access and documentation.

steps.title: Support
steps.description: We stay in touch after launch. Technical support, updates, and project development.

items.name: Anna Kovaleva
items.quote: The website paid for itself in the first month. Bookings tripled, and clients come already 'warm' — they've read everything about me on the site.

items.name: Maxim Petrov
items.quote: Finally the store works fast. Before, clients left because of slow loading. Now conversion has grown by 40%.

items.name: Elena Sokolova
items.quote: Really liked the approach — not just a pretty picture, but a thought-out structure. Every block works for conversion.

items.name: Dmitry Volkov
items.quote: Launched the landing in 2 weeks. Quality on par with top agencies, but without their budgets and bureaucracy.

items.name: Olga Mironova
items.quote: The website captures the studio atmosphere perfectly. Minimalism, space, calm — exactly what was needed.

faq.caption: Answers
faq.title: FAQ
faq.ctaSubtitle: Contact us — we'll reply within an hour

items.question: How long does development take?
items.answer: Timelines depend on project complexity. Landing page — 7–14 days, expert website — 14–21 days, online store — 21–45 days. Exact timelines are discussed after filling out the brief.

items.question: How much does a website cost? What affects the price?
items.answer: Cost depends on website type, number of pages, design complexity, and integrations. Landing page — from €500, expert website — from €1,000, online store — from €2,000. Exact cost is calculated individually.

items.question: What's included in turnkey development?
items.answer: Full cycle: brief and analytics, prototyping, unique design, responsive coding, basic SEO, analytics setup, testing and launch. You get a website ready to work.

items.question: Do I need a domain and hosting?
items.answer: Domain needs to be registered in advance or we'll help with selection and registration. Hosting — we use modern platforms (Vercel, Netlify) with free tiers for most projects.

items.question: How many revisions are included?
items.answer: Each stage includes a round of revisions: prototype, design, coding. Minor corrections — unlimited. Major concept changes are quoted separately.

items.question: Is there support after launch?
items.answer: Yes, 30 days of free support after launch: bug fixes, minor edits, consultations. After that — by support agreement or on-demand.

items.question: Will the website be SEO-optimized?
items.answer: Basic SEO is included: semantic markup, meta tags, sitemap, robots.txt, image optimization, loading speed. Promotion and content marketing — separate service.

items.question: What integrations are possible?
items.answer: Any: CRM (amoCRM, Bitrix24), payment systems (Stripe, PayPal), email newsletters, Telegram bots, booking calendars, analytics (GA4, etc.) and others on request.

items.question: How does payment work?
items.answer: In stages: 50% prepayment before starting, 50% after completion and acceptance. For large projects, splitting into 3 stages is possible. We work by contract.

items.question: What if I don't like the design?
items.answer: We approve each stage before moving to the next. If the design doesn't suit after the first iteration — we offer 2 alternative concepts. In case of complete disagreement — refund per contract.

about.heroDescription: We are a web studio that builds websites focused on results. Not just beautiful pages, but tools for growing your business.
about.approachText1: Every project starts with understanding your goals. We don't build websites 'like everyone else' — we create solutions for specific tasks.
about.approachText2: Strategy → Design → Development → Results. Every stage is approved, every decision is justified.
about.approachText3: Minimalism not for the sake of minimalism. We remove the unnecessary to leave what matters — what converts visitors into clients.

values.title: Results

values.title: Quality

sections.title: General Provisions
content: This Privacy Policy describes how NAKO Agency (hereinafter — "we", "our", "Company") collects, uses, and protects personal data of users of the website nakoagency.com (hereinafter — "Website").
By using the Website, you agree to the terms of this Policy. If you do not agree with the terms, please stop using the Website.

sections.title: Data We Collect
content: We may collect the following data:
Personal data provided by you: name, email address, phone number, Telegram username — when filling out forms on the Website.
Automatically collected data: IP address, browser type, device, pages visited, time spent on site — through cookies and analytics.
Data from third-party services: analytics data from Google Analytics, Vercel Analytics.

sections.title: Purposes of Data Processing
content: We use your data for:
Processing requests and applications submitted through Website forms.
Communicating with you regarding projects and services.
Improving the Website and user experience.
Analytics and statistical research.
Fulfilling legal obligations.

sections.title: Legal Basis for Processing
content: Data processing is carried out on the basis of:
Your consent (when filling out forms).
Legitimate interest (improving service and analytics).
Contractual necessity (fulfilling service obligations).
Legal obligation (compliance with applicable law).

sections.title: Sharing Data with Third Parties
content: We do not sell your personal data. Data may be shared with:
Service providers: Vercel (hosting), Resend (email), Google (analytics).
Legal authorities: upon lawful request.
All third-party services comply with data protection standards.

sections.title: Cookies
content: The Website uses cookies for:
Ensuring proper Website functionality.
Analytics and traffic analysis.
Improving user experience.
You can disable cookies in your browser settings, but this may affect Website functionality.

sections.title: Data Protection
content: We take reasonable measures to protect your data:
Data encryption in transit (HTTPS/TLS).
Access restricted to authorized personnel only.
Regular security audits.
However, no method of data transmission over the Internet is 100% secure.

sections.title: Data Retention Period
content: Personal data is stored for the period necessary to fulfill the purposes stated in this Policy, but no longer than:
Application data — 2 years from the date of submission.
Analytics data — 14 months (Google Analytics standard).
Cookies — up to 1 year.

sections.title: Your Rights
content: You have the right to:
Request access to your personal data.
Request correction of inaccurate data.
Request deletion of your data.
Withdraw consent to data processing.
File a complaint with the supervisory authority.
To exercise your rights, contact us at: hello@nakoagency.com

sections.title: Changes to the Policy
content: We reserve the right to modify this Policy at any time. Changes take effect upon publication on the Website. We recommend periodically reviewing the current version.
The date of the last update is indicated at the top of the document.

sections.title: Contact Information
content: If you have questions regarding this Policy, contact us:
Email: hello@nakoagency.com
Website: nakoagency.com

sections.title: General Provisions
content: These Terms of Use (hereinafter — "Terms") govern the use of the website nakoagency.com (hereinafter — "Website") operated by NAKO Agency (hereinafter — "Company", "we", "our").
By accessing and using the Website, you agree to these Terms. If you do not agree, please stop using the Website.

sections.title: Description of Services
content: The Company provides turnkey website development services, including:
Website strategy and planning.
UI/UX design.
Frontend and backend development.
SEO optimization.
Technical support and maintenance.
Detailed description of services and conditions is provided during individual consultation.

sections.title: Website Usage
content: When using the Website, you agree to:
Provide accurate information when filling out forms.
Not use the Website for illegal purposes.
Not attempt to gain unauthorized access to the Website or its systems.
Not distribute malicious software through the Website.
Not copy, modify, or distribute Website content without written permission.

sections.title: Intellectual Property
content: All Website content is the intellectual property of NAKO Agency:
Design, layout, and visual elements.
Texts, images, and graphics.
Source code and software solutions.
Logos and trademarks.
Using Website materials without written permission from the Company is prohibited.

sections.title: Service Delivery Procedure
content: Services are provided on the basis of:
Application through the Website form or email.
Discussion of requirements and approval of the brief.
Signing of the service agreement.
Stage-by-stage delivery and approval.
Specific conditions, timelines, and costs are determined individually for each project.

sections.title: Payment for Services
content: Payment terms:
Payment is made according to the terms specified in the agreement.
Standard payment scheme: 50% prepayment, 50% upon completion.
For large projects, payment may be split into 3 stages.
Payment methods are agreed upon individually.
Refund terms are specified in the agreement.

sections.title: Limitation of Liability
content: The Company shall not be liable for:
Temporary unavailability of the Website due to technical maintenance.
Losses arising from the use or inability to use the Website.
Actions of third parties, including hosting providers and payment systems.
Force majeure circumstances.
The Company's total liability is limited to the amount paid by the client under the agreement.

sections.title: Disclaimer of Warranties
content: The Website is provided "as is". The Company does not guarantee:
Uninterrupted Website operation.
Absence of technical errors.
Compliance of the Website with your specific requirements.
Accuracy and completeness of information posted on the Website.
We strive to ensure the highest quality but cannot guarantee the absence of any defects.

sections.title: Links to Third-Party Resources
content: The Website may contain links to third-party websites. We are not responsible for:
Content of third-party websites.
Privacy policies of third-party resources.
Any losses arising from the use of third-party resources.

sections.title: Changes to Terms
content: We reserve the right to modify these Terms at any time without prior notice. Changes take effect upon publication on the Website.
Continued use of the Website after changes have been made constitutes your acceptance of the new Terms.
The date of the last update is indicated at the top of the document.

sections.title: Applicable Law
content: These Terms are governed by applicable law. Any disputes arising in connection with the use of the Website are resolved through negotiations, and if no agreement is reached — in court in accordance with applicable law.

sections.title: Contact Information
content: If you have questions regarding these Terms, contact us:
Email: hello@nakoagency.com
Website: nakoagency.com

why-nextjs-for-business.title: Why Next.js Is the Best Choice for a Business Website in 2024
why-nextjs-for-business.excerpt: We break down the advantages of Next.js for commercial projects: SEO, performance, scalability.
why-nextjs-for-business.author: NAKO Agency Team
why-nextjs-for-business.content:
Introduction

Next.js has become the standard for building modern web applications. In 2024, this is especially relevant for business websites where SEO, loading speed, and scalability matter.

In this article, we'll break down why we choose Next.js for commercial projects and what advantages it gives our clients.

Built-in SEO

The main advantage of Next.js for business is excellent SEO. Unlike regular React applications, Next.js supports server-side rendering (SSR) and static site generation (SSG).

This means search engines see a fully rendered page rather than empty HTML with JavaScript. The result is fast indexing and high search rankings.

  • Automatic meta tag generation
  • Built-in Open Graph support
  • Automatic sitemap.xml
  • Core Web Vitals optimization

Performance

Next.js optimizes performance at the framework level. Automatic code splitting, image optimization, link prefetching — all of this works out of the box.

For business, this is critical: every second of loading delay can cost conversions. With Next.js, we consistently achieve Lighthouse Scores of 90+.

Developer Experience

Good DX means fast development and fewer bugs. Next.js provides:

  • Hot Module Replacement for instant changes
  • TypeScript out of the box
  • Built-in API Routes
  • Excellent documentation and community

Conclusions

Next.js isn't just a trendy framework — it's a tool that solves real business problems. SEO, performance, scalability — all out of the box.

If you're planning to build a website that needs to bring clients from search and convert visitors — Next.js is the right choice.

conversion-design-principles.title: 7 Principles of Conversion-Driven Design
conversion-design-principles.excerpt: How design impacts sales. Practical techniques that boost conversion.
conversion-design-principles.author: NAKO Agency Team
conversion-design-principles.content:
1. Visual Hierarchy

The user's eye should move across the page in the right direction. Size, color, contrast — these are tools for managing attention.

The main offer should be immediately noticeable. Secondary information — smaller and lighter.

2. Clear CTA

The call-to-action button should be obvious. Contrasting color, clear text, sufficient size.

One main CTA per screen. Don't force the user to choose between multiple equally weighted actions.

3. Whitespace in Design

Empty space is not wasted space. It's a tool that helps highlight what's important and improve readability.

An overloaded design tires users and reduces conversion. Let the content breathe.

4. Trust Elements

Reviews, client logos, certificates, guarantees — everything that confirms your reliability.

Place them near the CTA — this reduces anxiety before making a decision.

5. Loading Speed

Beautiful design is useless if the page takes 10 seconds to load. Optimization is part of design.

Lighthouse Score 90+ is the minimum standard for a commercial website.

seo-for-new-websites.title: SEO for a New Website: Step-by-Step Checklist
seo-for-new-websites.excerpt: What you need to do for SEO before launch and in the first months of your website.
seo-for-new-websites.author: NAKO Agency Team
seo-for-new-websites.content:
Before Launch

SEO starts before the website goes live. Preparation at this stage will save months of work.

  • Keyword research
  • URL structure
  • Content planning
  • Analytics setup

Technical SEO

The foundation without which other efforts are meaningless:

  • HTTPS is mandatory
  • Mobile version
  • Loading speed < 3 sec
  • Proper heading structure
  • XML sitemap
  • robots.txt

Content

Unique, useful content is the foundation of SEO. Every page should answer a specific user query.

Meta title and description for every page. Alt text for images. Internal linking.

First Months

After launch — monitoring and improvements:

  • Search Console registration
  • Position tracking
  • User behavior analysis
  • Regular content additions

expert-website-roi.title: Website ROI for Experts: Real Numbers
expert-website-roi.excerpt: How much a website costs, how many clients it brings, and when it pays for itself. A breakdown with examples.
expert-website-roi.author: NAKO Agency Team
expert-website-roi.content:
Website Cost

A website for an expert costs from €1,000 to €3,000 depending on complexity. It's a one-time investment that works for years.

Traffic Sources

Where clients come from to an expert's website:

  • Organic search (SEO) — 40-60%
  • Social media — 20-30%
  • Referrals — 10-20%
  • Advertising — 10-15%

Conversion

Average conversion for an expert's website is 3-7%. With 1,000 visitors per month, that's 30-70 leads.

Conversion to client is about 30%. Total: 9-21 new clients per month.

ROI Calculation

Example: average consultation fee — €100. 15 clients x €100 = €1,500/month.

With a website cost of €2,000, the payback period is about 1.5 months. After that — pure profit.

tailwind-vs-css-modules.title: Tailwind CSS vs CSS Modules: Which to Choose
tailwind-vs-css-modules.excerpt: Comparing two styling approaches in React projects. Pros, cons, and when to use each.
tailwind-vs-css-modules.author: NAKO Agency Team
tailwind-vs-css-modules.content:
Tailwind Pros

  • Fast development — no need to invent class names
  • Consistency — design tokens out of the box
  • Small final CSS — only used styles
  • Easy theme customization

Tailwind Cons

  • Long class strings in markup
  • Learning curve
  • Complex states require many classes

CSS Modules Pros

  • Familiar CSS syntax
  • Style isolation by default
  • Easy to migrate existing CSS

When to Use Each

Tailwind — for new projects where development speed and consistency matter.

CSS Modules — for projects with an existing design system or a team accustomed to classic CSS.

minimalism-in-web-design.title: Minimalism in Web Design: Trend or Necessity
minimalism-in-web-design.excerpt: Why less is more. How minimalist design affects UX and conversion.
minimalism-in-web-design.author: NAKO Agency Team
minimalism-in-web-design.content:
Why Minimalism Works

Minimalism isn't about emptiness — it's about focus. When there's nothing extra on the page, the user sees what matters.

Research shows: simple pages are perceived as more reliable and professional.

Principles of Minimalism

  • One main focus point per screen
  • Maximum 2-3 colors
  • Plenty of whitespace between elements
  • Clear typography

Common Mistakes

Minimalism does not equal boring. An empty page without focal points isn't minimalism — it's bad design.

Every element should work. If something doesn't carry meaning — remove it.

lighthouse-score-optimization.title: How to Boost Lighthouse Score to 90+
lighthouse-score-optimization.excerpt: A practical guide to website performance optimization. Core Web Vitals, images, code.
lighthouse-score-optimization.author: NAKO Agency Team
lighthouse-score-optimization.content:
Core Web Vitals

Google's three main metrics:

  • LCP (Largest Contentful Paint) < 2.5 sec
  • FID (First Input Delay) < 100 ms
  • CLS (Cumulative Layout Shift) < 0.1

Images

The main source of performance issues:

  • WebP/AVIF formats
  • Lazy loading
  • Proper sizes (srcset)
  • Blur placeholder

Code Optimization

  • Code splitting
  • Tree shaking
  • Minification
  • Removing unused CSS

Fonts

Fonts often block rendering:

  • font-display: swap
  • Preloading critical fonts
  • Character subsetting

landing-page-anatomy.title: Anatomy of a Perfect Landing Page
landing-page-anatomy.excerpt: What blocks a landing page should have and in what order. A structure that sells.
landing-page-anatomy.author: NAKO Agency Team
landing-page-anatomy.content:
Hero Section

The first screen decides everything. In 5 seconds, the user should understand:

  • What you offer
  • Who it's for
  • Why they should stay

Benefits

Not features, but benefits. Not '10 years of experience', but 'We'll solve your problem in 3 days'.

3-5 key benefits with icons or illustrations.

Social Proof

Reviews, case studies, client logos, numbers — everything that backs up your claims.

Place them closer to the CTA — this reduces doubt.

CTA Block

The final call to action. Briefly restate the offer and add a form or button.

Remove everything unnecessary — just the action.

landing-saas.title: SaaS Product Landing
landing-saas.description: Conversion page for a cloud analytics service.
landing-saas.task: Create a high-conversion landing page for a SaaS product in business analytics. The page should explain a complex product in simple terms and motivate free trial registration.
solution: Developed structure with progressive information disclosure
Implemented A/B testing of CTA blocks
Integrated with CRM for lead tracking

expert-psychologist.title: Psychologist Website
expert-psychologist.description: Personal website with online booking and calendar integration.
expert-psychologist.task: Develop a website for a practicing psychologist with online booking capability. Design should create a sense of calm and trust. Privacy and booking simplicity are important.
solution: Set up email notifications for bookings

ecommerce-cosmetics.title: Cosmetics Store
ecommerce-cosmetics.description: Online store for natural cosmetics with subscription.
ecommerce-cosmetics.task: Create a premium online store for natural cosmetics with visual and storytelling focus. Add subscription option for regular delivery.
solution: Developed visually rich design with photo emphasis
Implemented subscription system with flexible intervals
Optimized for SEO in cosmetics niche

landing-event.title: Event Promo Page
landing-event.description: Landing page for a business conference with online registration.
landing-event.task: Create a promo page for an IT conference with online registration and ticket payment. The page should create hype and FOMO effect.
solution: Created dynamic design with countdown timer
Implemented different ticket types with pricing
Set up email marketing for registrants

expert-lawyer.title: Law Practice Website
expert-lawyer.description: Corporate website for a lawyer with case portfolio and booking.
expert-lawyer.task: Develop a prestigious website for a lawyer that demonstrates experience and expertise. Trust, professionalism, and quick contact capability are important.
solution: Integrated online chat for quick communication

ecommerce-electronics.title: Electronics Store
ecommerce-electronics.description: Online gadget store with smart search and filters.
ecommerce-electronics.task: Create a modern electronics online store with UX focus and fast search. Catalog of 2000+ products with many specifications.
solution: Implemented wishlist and price drop notifications

landing-app.title: Mobile App Landing
landing-app.description: Promo page for a fitness app with App Store links.
landing-app.task: Create a landing page for a mobile fitness app that motivates downloads. Show functionality and benefits, integrate App Store and Google Play links.
